content.description: Two cubes, Cube <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Cube <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, of different sizes, as shown, and with different initial temperatures are placed in contact and isolated from their surroundings. At time <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>, Cube <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> is at a higher temperature than Cube <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. At a later time <math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, the two cubes have reached thermal equilibrium. If <math alttext="K sub X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> are the average kinetic energies of the molecules in Cube <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and Cube <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, respectively, how do these kinetic energies compare at <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math>?
content.question: <math alttext="t sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math>A<math alttext="K sub X is greater than K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="K sub X is less than K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>B<math alttext="K sub X is greater than K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="K sub X equals K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>C<math alttext="K sub X is less than K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="K sub X is less than K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>D<math alttext="K sub X is less than K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math><math alttext="K sub X equals K sub Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>X</mtext></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mtext>Y</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
